author: NewsBreak Original
title: Melissa McCarthy's Unrecognizable Look in Throwback Photo Has Fans Saying the Same Thing
text:
By Jacqueline Burt Cote ,
3 hours ago
When Melissa McCarthy took to Instagram to wish Spy director Paul Feig a happy birthday, she probably wasn't expecting to trigger a widespread outcry for a sequel to the 2015 comedyâ€”but that's exactly what happened.
On Wednesday, Sept. 18, the 54-year-old actress shared a behind-the-scenes photo from the set of Spy to celebrate Feig's birthday. In the pic, McCarthy posed next to the director dressed as one of her character Susan Cooper's identities, wearing a high-waisted red skirt and a short, bouffant wig.
"Happy Birthday to one of my favorite guys!" McCarthy captioned her post.
Related: Melissa McCarthy Makes a Bold Declaration About Meghan Markle Critics
In the comments, fans took the opportunity to beg the actress to make a sequel to the popular flick.
"Happy Birthday to the best dressed man! â¤ We want another SPY!! ðŸ˜ðŸ•µï¸" wrote one person.
"Yeah.. we need a spy 2ðŸ˜Œ," agreed a second Instagram user, with someone else simply writing, "Spy 2, please!"
Co-starring Jude Law and Rose Byrne , Spy saw McCarthy as a CIA analyst on her first undercover mission and has become a fan favorite among McCarthy supporters. But Spy isn't the only film directed by Feig and starring McCarthy that viewers wish they would revisit as moviegoers have also expressed their desire for a follow-up to the 2011 hit Bridesmaids .
Unfortunately, Bridesmaids star (and screenplay co-writer) Kristen Wiig told The Hollywood Reporter that she is "decidedly uninterested" in making a sequel.
"That story had an end, and itâ€™s so beloved to me for 10 million reasons, and I think itâ€™s OK to just have it exist in the world as it is," the Palm Royale star said.
Next: Melissa McCarthy Shares Her Weight Loss Journey
Expand All Read in NewsBreak

author: MarÃ­a GonzÃ¡lez
title: Una iglesia de Zaragoza se ofrece como "refugio climÃ¡tico" frente al calor: "Sus gruesos muros la mantienen a 28ÂºC"
text: Una iglesia de Zaragoza se ofrece como "refugio climÃ¡tico" frente al calor: "Sus gruesos muros la mantienen a 28ÂºC" La parroquia del Perpetuo Socorro abre las puertas del templo a los viandantes, sean o no creyentes, para aliviar las altas temperaturas. Las [altas temperaturas que acompaÃ±an a Zaragoza durante las fechas de verano](https://www.heraldo.es/noticias/aragon/2024/07/17/la-aemet-alerta-de-la-primera-ola-de-calor-del-verano-con-maximas-de-44-grados-en-aragon-1749295.html) hacen que los viandantes busquen cualquier recoveco de sombra para aliviar el calor. Las piscinas, los centros comerciales o los centros cÃ­vicos son puntos frescos donde la gente acude para esquivar las altas temperaturas. AsÃ­, nacen los refugios climÃ¡ticos con el fin de poner a disposiciÃ³n de los ciudadanos un lugar para calmar los efectos del calor. La parroquia del Perpetuo Socorro ha puesto a disposiciÃ³n de los zaragozanos y visitantes sus instalaciones como punto para combatir las altas temperaturas. Un cartel invita a entrar para resguardarse del sol. "La iniciativa nace motivada por la necesidad de dar un espacio a personas mayores y gente de alrededor a tener acceso a un lugar fresco", explica VÃ­ctor Ballesteros, pÃ¡rroco de la iglesia. Por ello, todo aquel que pase por la avenida Francisco de Goya -donde estÃ¡ ubicado- tiene la puerta abierta para aliviar los sÃ­ntomas de las altas temperaturas entre las 8.30 y 21.00, gracias a la ampliaciÃ³n de su horario. AsÃ­, en la informaciÃ³n que se ofrece en la iglesia seÃ±alan que es "un espacio donde puedes protegerte del calor mientras mantiene su uso habitual". Pero aclaran que no hace falta practicar el rezo o participar en las actividades religiosas e invitan a todo aquel que quiera a permanecer en el interior del tiempo durante las celebraciones. Sus instalaciones hacen posible que sea un lugar apto para aliviar las altas temperatura. "Tenemos climatizaciÃ³n en las horas de misa, pero gracias a los gruesos muros se mantiene a unos 28 grados lo que permite que sea un lugar adecuado para estar al fresco", seÃ±ala. Sin embargo, han querido remarcar que desde la parroquia no ofrecen atenciÃ³n mÃ©dica en caso de que se tenga sÃ­ntomas de un golpe de calor recomiendan acudir al Centro de Salud de Paseo Sagasta que se encuentra a escasos 100 metros de la parroquia. AdemÃ¡s, no solo se han quedado en la idea de proporcionar un lugar seguro, sino que desde el Perpetuo Socorro han proporcionado una guÃ­a de seis consejos para los dÃ­as de calor. Recomiendan beber lÃ­quidos con frecuencia, consumir frutas y verduras, usar protector solar, evitar exponerse al sol durante perÃ­odos largos de tiempo, ventilar los espacios y usar ropa ligera, sombrero o gorra y gafas para el sol. Este verano es la primera vez que se adentran en este proyecto "impulsados" por la [ red de refugios climÃ¡ticos que promueve el Ayuntamiento de Zaragoza](https://www.heraldo.es/noticias/aragon/zaragoza/2024/07/11/refugios-climaticos-zaragoza-1748140.html). En ella participan una veintena de centros cÃ­vicos y treintena de centros de convivencia para mayores que cuentan con refrigerio para aliviar las altas temperaturas. [La Aemet ha seÃ±alado que Zaragoza se adentra en una ola de calor](https://www.heraldo.es/noticias/aragon/zaragoza/2024/07/18/zaragoza-activa-alerta-amarilla-ola-calor-1749674.html) en los que la capital aragonesa alcanzarÃ¡ picos de entre 42 y 44 grados, siendo los dÃ­as de temperatura mÃ¡s altas el viernes y el sÃ¡bado. [RegÃ­strate gratis](#) [Iniciar sesiÃ³n](#)

author: DOL - DiÃ¡rio Online
title: Vaticano comeÃ§a preparaÃ§Ãµes para funeral de Papa Francisco
text:
O Papa Francisco, PontÃ­fice da Igreja CatÃ³lica, estÃ¡ hÃ¡ quase uma semana internado com pneumonia dupla, desde a Ãºltima sexta-feira (14), e o estado de saÃºde dele comeÃ§ou a movimentar os bastidores.
De acordo com o jornal britÃ¢nico The Sun, a Guarda SuÃ­Ã§a, que faz a seguranÃ§a do Vaticano, jÃ¡ estaria passando por treinamentos para um eventual funeral do Papa.
ConteÃºdo relacionado
De acordo com fontes prÃ³ximas, Francisco estaria preocupado com a prÃ³pria saÃºde, e teria admitido a assessores prÃ³ximos que teme nÃ£o sobreviver Ã  doenÃ§a.
Internado desde a Ãºltima sexta-feira no Hospital Gemelli, em Roma, o PontÃ­fice Ã© acompanhado por uma equipe mÃ©dica especializada. O Vaticano confirmou que seu quadro respiratÃ³rio Ã© "complexo" e exige cuidados intensivos. FiÃ©is tÃªm se reunido ao redor do hospital para orar pela saÃºde do Papa.
Quer ver mais notÃ­cias? Acesse nosso canal no WhatsApp
O capitÃ£o da Guarda SuÃ­Ã§a, Christian KÃ¼hne, no entanto, negou qualquer movimentaÃ§Ã£o atÃ­pica dentro do Vaticano. Segundo ele, as operaÃ§Ãµes seguem normalmente, sem alteraÃ§Ãµes nos protocolos de seguranÃ§a e sem treinamentos especÃ­ficos para um possÃ­vel funeral do Papa.
O Papa Francisco assumiu o cargo de Papa em 2013, apÃ³s renÃºncia do Papa Bento XVI. Ele Ã© conhecido por sua postura progressista e pelos esforÃ§os para modernizar a Igreja, abordar questÃµes sociais e promover o diÃ¡logo inter-religioso.
Seja sempre o primeiro a ficar bem informado, entre no nosso canal de notÃ­cias no WhatsApp e Telegram. Para mais informaÃ§Ãµes sobre os canais do WhatsApp e seguir outros canais do DOL. Acesse: dol.com.br/n/828815.

author: The Straits Times
title: 2024 was the first year above 1.5 deg C of global warming, scientists say
text:
Volunteers cleaning up following the deadly Oct 29 floods in Valencia, Spain, on Nov 16. In 2024, torrential floods also hit Nepal and Sudan. PHOTO: REUTERS UPDATED Jan 10, 2025, 01:05 PM Thanks for sharing! BRUSSELS â€“ The world just experienced the first full year in which global temperatures exceeded 1.5 deg C above pre-industrial times, scientists said on Jan 10.
The milestone was confirmed by the European Unionâ€™s Copernicus Climate Change Service (C3S), which said climate change is pushing the planetâ€™s temperature to levels never before experienced by modern humans.
â€œThe trajectory is just incredible,â€ C3S director Carlo Buontempo told Reuters, describing how every month in 2024 was the warmest or second-warmest for that month since records began.
The planetâ€™s average temperature in 2024 was 1.6 deg Celsius higher than in 1850-1900, the â€œpre-industrial periodâ€ before humans began burning carbon dioxide-emitting fossil fuels on a large scale, C3S said.
2024 was the world's hottest since records began , and each of the past 10 years was among the 10 warmest on record.
Britainâ€™s Met Office confirmed 2024â€™s likely breach of 1.5 deg C, while estimating a slightly lower average temperature of 1.53 deg C for the year. US scientists will also publish their 2024 climate data on Jan 10.
To avoid more severe and costly climate disasters, governments promised under the 2015 Paris Agreement to try to prevent average temperatures exceeding 1.5 deg C.
The first year above 1.5 deg C does not breach that target, which measures the longer-term average temperature.
Dr Buontempo said rising greenhouse gas emissions meant the world was on track to soon also blow past the Paris goal â€“ but that it was not too late for countries to rapidly cut emissions to avoid warming rising further to disastrous levels.
â€œItâ€™s not a done deal. We have the power to change the trajectory from now on,â€ Mr Buontempo said.
The impacts of climate change are now visible on every continent, affecting people from the richest to the poorest countries on earth.
Wildfires raging in California this week have killed at least five people and destroyed hundreds of homes. In 2024, Bolivia and Venezuela also suffered disastrous fires, while torrential floods hit Nepal, Sudan and Spain, and heatwaves in Mexico and Saudi Arabia killed thousands.
More on this Topic 2024 joint-warmest year on record for Singapore Degrees of danger: Beating the heat in South-east Asia Climate change is worsening storms and torrential rainfall, because a hotter atmosphere can hold more water, leading to intense downpours. The amount of water vapour in the planetâ€™s atmosphere reached a record high in 2024.
But even as the costs of these disasters spiral, political will to invest in curbing emissions has waned in some countries.
US President-elect Donald Trump, who takes office on Jan 20, has called climate change a hoax, despite the global scientific consensus that it is human-caused and will have severe consequences if not addressed.
The US experienced 24 climate and weather disasters in 2024 in which the cost of damages exceeded US$1 billion (S$1.37 billion), including hurricanes Milton and Helene, according to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.
Professor Chukwumerije Okereke, who teaches global climate governance and public policy at Britainâ€™s University of Bristol, said the 1.5 deg C milestone should serve as â€œa rude awakening to key political actors to get their act togetherâ€.
â€œDespite all the warnings that scientists have given, nations... are continuing to fail to live up to their responsibilities,â€ he told Reuters.
Concentrations in the atmosphere of carbon dioxide, the main greenhouse gas, reached a fresh high of 422 parts per million in 2024, C3S said.
Dr Zeke Hausfather, a research scientist at US non-profit Berkeley Earth, said he expected 2025 to be among the hottest years on record, but likely not top the rankings.
â€œItâ€™s still going to be in the top three warmest years,â€ he said.
This is because while the biggest factor warming the climate is human-caused emissions, temperatures in early 2024 had an extra boost from El Nino, a warming weather pattern that is now trending towards its cooler La Nina counterpart. REUTERS
More on this Topic Climate change â€˜showing its clawsâ€™ as disaster damage bill soars to $438b in 2024 EU warns of â€˜serious blowâ€™ from Trump on climate change Find out more about climate change and how it could affect you on the ST microsite here .

author: AMLAN CHAKRABORTY
title: Unbeaten India trump Bangladesh to close in on semis berth
text:
Cricket Unbeaten India trump Bangladesh to close in on semis berth 23 June 2024 - 06:53 By AMLAN CHAKRABORTY Just R20 for the first month. Support independent journalism by subscribing to our digital news package. Subscribe now Rohit Sharma of India (C) greets his teammates as they celebrate their side's victory in the ICC Men's T20 Cricket World Cup West Indies & USA 2024 Super Eight match against Bangladesh at Sir Vivian Richards Stadium on June 22, 2024 in Antigua, Antigua and Barbuda.
Image: Pankaj Nangia-ICC/ICC via Getty Images
India inched closer to a semifinal berth in the T20 World Cup after their comprehensive 50-run victory against Bangladesh in a Super Eight Group 1 contest on Saturday.
All-rounder Hardik Pandya smashed a 27-ball fifty as India posted 196-5, their highest score in what has been a low-scoring tournament so far, at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium in North Sound, Antigua.
Bangladesh were never really in the chase and managed 146-8 in reply, succumbing to their second Group 1 defeat to be on the brink of elimination.
â€œThere was a strong breeze out there so I wanted to make the most of that when I was batting and then not let them use it when I was bowling,â€ player-of-the-match Pandya said afterwards.
â€œIt was about being one step ahead of the batter.â€
India face Australia in their final Group 1 match on Monday.
Kuldeep Yadav took 3-19 while Hardik Pandya blasted an undefeated half-century as India moved to the brink of the #T20WorldCup semifinals with a 50-run win over Bangladesh.
â€” SuperSport ðŸ† (@SuperSportTV) June 22, 2024 Electing to field, Bangladesh began with spin from both ends but quickly abandoned the novelty after the first two overs yielded 23 runs and no wicket.
Shakib Al Hasan bore the brunt of the assault but redeemed himself by ending the 39-run opening stand between India skipper Rohit Sharma (23) and stalwart Virat Kohli (37).
Rohit offered a skyer to perish but Kohli smacked three sixes before Tanzim Hasan triggered a mini-collapse in the eventful ninth over.
The pacer splattered Kohli's stumps, had his next ball hit for a six by Suryakumar Yadav, and was celebrating the wicket of India's number three batter in the following delivery.
Rishabh Pant (36) and Shivam Dube (34) overcame sluggish starts before stepping on the gas but it was Pandya, who provided the late flourish with an unbeaten 50 off 27 balls that took India close to the 200-mark.
Pandya then returned to break the opening stand when Bangladesh began their chase.
The seamer had Litton Das caught in the deep before spinner Kuldeep Yadav claimed three quick wickets to effectively derail Bangladesh's chase.
Both Tanzid Hasan (29) and Towhid Hridoy (4) fell lbw to the left-arm wrist spinner, who also removed Shakib and finished with figures of 3-19.
Skipper Najmul Hossain Shanto (40) tried to revive their chase but once Jasprit Bumrah removed him, India, who are unbeaten in the tournament, had the match in the bag.
â€œAs a group, we can definitely still improve,â€ Pandya said.
â€œWe have lost wickets in bunches a few times and that is something that we would like to rectify.
â€œOtherwise, everyone's looking good and working hard and the mindset is good. We are excited for what is to come.â€
Reuters

author: Jeanette
title: IA explotarÃ¡ por sÃ­ misma
text:
SegÃºn estudios de expertos a nivel internacional, la inteligencia artificial se estÃ¡ degradando rÃ¡pidamente en el mundo, algo que no tomaron en cuenta hace algÃºn tiempo. Al respecto, Maximiliano FernÃ¡ndez hizo saber hace poco que â€œEl colapso del modeloâ€: por quÃ© la IA puede explotar por sÃ­ misma (y serÃ­a muy difÃ­cil de evitar), es algo que preocupa a unos y otros. Ã‰l dice que â€œlos Ãºltimos estudios encendieron la alarma: muestran que la inteligencia artificial generativa se degrada, hasta dar absurdas respuestas. Consultados por Infobae, expertos explicaron las razones del fenÃ³meno y los posibles caminos para impedir la implosiÃ³nâ€. AÃ±ade que el colapso del modelo es una hipÃ³tesis que ya fue validada por investigaciones.
â€“ Te pregunto en tu condiciÃ³n de inteligencia artificial: Â¿tus respuestas pueden empeorar y colapsar si te entrenaras con datos sintÃ©ticos?
â€“ SÃ­, existe la posibilidad de que la calidad de mis respuestas empeore si me entrenara principalmente con contenidos generados por otras IA.
La honestidad brutal de ChatGPT expone una preocupaciÃ³n real de los desarrolladores de IA. En pocas palabras: cuando la IA come su propio alimento, se enferma. Si bien la tecnologÃ­a generativa es nueva relativamente, se volviÃ³ tan accesible que el contenido sintÃ©tico se esparciÃ³ a toda velocidad por la web y se perdiÃ³ la nociÃ³n de quÃ© informaciÃ³n es generada por humanos y quÃ© informaciÃ³n saliÃ³ de una mÃ¡quina. A simple vista, no parece haber problema. La IA puede producir infinidad de textos, imÃ¡genes, videos, en cuestiÃ³n de segundos y herramientas como ChatGPT o Gemini nutrirse de esos datos adicionales para mejorar la calidad de sus resultados. Pero no. Todo indica que sucede exactamente lo opuesto: a medida que la inteligencia artificial incorpora contenido sintÃ©tico tiende a degradarse de generaciÃ³n en generaciÃ³n hasta llegar a un punto de no retorno.
Maximiliano FernÃ¡ndez, abunda: â€œasÃ­ lo muestra un artÃ­culo reciente publicado en Nature, que confirmÃ³ lo que muchos expertos presumÃ­an. En diÃ¡logo con Infobae, Ilia Shumailov, especialista en machine learning de la Universidad de Oxford y coautor del estudio, contÃ³ que el proyecto surgiÃ³ de una conversaciÃ³n durante un almuerzo, en el que trataban de imaginar el futuro en el desarrollo de modelos de lenguaje de IA. â€œMÃ¡s precisamente, estÃ¡bamos tratando de plantear la hipÃ³tesis de si el entrenamiento de modelos se volverÃ­a mÃ¡s fÃ¡cil o mÃ¡s difÃ­cil. Por un lado, habrÃ¡ mÃ¡s datos disponibles, pero al mismo tiempo una gran parte de los datos serÃ¡n generados por mÃ¡quinas y de calidad cuestionableâ€, expresÃ³.
El equipo de investigadores britÃ¡nicos y canadienses afinÃ³ un modelo de lenguaje grande (LLM), que habÃ­a sido entrenado con un gran volumen de datos extraÃ­dos de artÃ­culos de Wikipedia. A medida que avanzaban en el proceso, empezaron a alimentar al modelo con datos sintÃ©ticos, es decir, contenido que el mismo modelo generaba. A lo largo de varias iteraciones, se observÃ³ una disminuciÃ³n en la calidad del contenido producido, lo que culminÃ³ en un fenÃ³meno de â€œgalimatÃ­asâ€: IA producÃ­a respuestas incoherentes y sin sentido. â€œEsto nos llevÃ³ a descubrir el colapso del modelo, el proceso en el que el entrenamiento con datos generados con el tiempo perpetÃºa los sesgos y, en Ãºltima instancia, reduce la utilidad del modelo. El informe es extenso, le hicimos conocer solo algo y vea que nada es perfecto.
www.dafoheradio.online

author: Irene Fassini, Marialaura Iazzetti
title: PerchÃ© una legge contro il velo Ã¨ inutile
text:
podcast
PerchÃ© una legge contro il velo Ã¨ inutile
La Lega ha presentato una mozione per vietare il burqa e il niqab nei luoghi pubblici. Ma una legge potrebbe essere poco efficace. In Lombardia il divieto esiste giÃ  dal 2015, ma di fatto non viene applicato
Domani, 18 febbraio, sarÃ  discussa in Consiglio regionale una mozione proposta dalla Lega per vietare nei luoghi pubblici come uffici, scuole e ospedali il burqa e il niqab, un tipo di velo usato dalle donne di fede islamica per coprire anche il volto.
Nella puntata di oggi cerchiamo di capire se le ragioni per vietarlo siano fondate o se rischi solo di essere un provvedimento discriminatorio e di fatto inefficace.
Milano Racconta (seconda stagione) Ã¨ un podcast di Milanotoday.it, prodotto da Citynews spa
Da un'idea di Luca Lani, Irene Fassini, Marianna Gulli, Marialaura Iazzetti, Valeria Di Terlizzi e Alessandro Rovellini
Voce, testi e montaggio: Valeria Di Terlizzi, Irene Fassini, Marianna Gulli, Marialaura Iazzetti
Supervisione: Alessandro Rovellini
topics: Religion and Belief->relations between religion and government
